website_summaries.verdict: A durable, easy-to-use kickstand that's great for larger bikes.
pros: Spring-loaded latch for easy length adjustment without tools
cons: A few have complained that the kickstand has a tendency to slide down as you pedal

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy kickstand, handles larger wheel sizes, and fits Diamondback Sorrento bikes, great!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a very study and adjustable kickstand that stays clear of the petals. I was concerned that given it's adjustable nature it would slip out of position but the adjustments firmly lock into place. Also, it is installed on a Diamondback Sorrento bike with 27.5 inch wheels so no problem with bigger wheel sizes. See photos for fit example.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Super Kick Stand and a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: It's a great kickstand when installed properly... You're best bet is to turn bike over and install, you'll be able to line up kickstand perfectly this way. Kick stand easily opens and positively closes. Good strong spring so far. I installed this on a 26" Hardtail, needed to adjust length and it works beautifully, you will need a wrench. Length adjustment is very easy and straight forward, no tools needed. One note, this probably would not fit every bike out there. I don't believe it would fit my older 700C hybrid due to space behind seat post...
customer_reviews.author: theunartistTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand, but not for Giant Roam 3 -- REVISED
customer_reviews.text: This looks like it would be a terrific kickstand, very sturdy & well-built and smoothly operating. I was impressed by the build quality for under $11. However, the kickstand does not fit on my (very common) Giant Roam 3 bike, so I never got to use it. There are small, undetachable clips welded into the bike frame that hold brake cables and those clips block the mounting hardware. We tried everything, but the kickstand is now in a drawer & we've ordered an alternate BV model that attaches to the rear forks. If not for this incompatibility -- which was impossible to predict from the photos & description on the product page! -- this would easily be a five-star review.
customer_reviews.author: cundare

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, actually seems quite nice except ...
customer_reviews.text: I had to send the first one back as the bolts didn't fit the threads in the kickstand. Thought they just needed to be chased with a good tap. Got the new one today. Bolts are M10 1.5, the threaded hole in the kickstand is not. Don't know what it is, none of my thread guages fit. Not Metric, not standard. WTH? Oh, and I don't think it's because they powder coated it AFTER cutting the threads (which they did).
customer_reviews.author: Kael Blackwood

customer_reviews.title: Good but no instructions included
customer_reviews.text: Just installed it and so far it’s great. I had to adjust it a couple times to keep it from touching the tire or pedal but now that it’s right it’s great. Annoyingly, it didn’t come with instructions. I had to come back to the product listing here and read it on a tiny picture. Doable but frustrating because a small slip of paper could have easily been included.
customer_reviews.author: Catie A.

customer_reviews.title: Wouldn't stay put
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand wouldn't stay in place. Whenever I put the kickstand in the down position, it moved ever so slightly (clockwise) until eventually the pedal would hit it when in the up position. I tightened it done a ton, and still the same issue. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: staffordScott

customer_reviews.title: Works... but...
customer_reviews.text: It works.. but it's a pain that the manufactures doesn't give information on the size of the wrench you need to make it tight. If you want to do the job correctly you are going to NEED and allen wrench, but what size do you need???? I purchased a bunch of SAE allen wrenches and they were too big or too small. The 50T "Star" style allen wrench worked, but that is not the style of the head on the screw. I suspect this is using a metric allen wrench, but the company should provide the information so the customers can install properly.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar L.

customer_reviews.title: Like it so much, I just keep buying more!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 3rd time that I've purchased this kick-stand. It is a huge improvement over most of the ones that come with bikes you buy. It looks good, is easy to put up/down, and easily adjusts. The height adjustment is a killer feature and ensures that it will perfectly fit pretty much any bike that it is rated for. I haven't had any problems with the ones I have purchased. Pros: Easy height adjustment Mounting hardware for two most common mount types Works flawlessly Looks good Priced right Cons: None
customer_reviews.author: Kirk L

customer_reviews.title: Poor choice of screws and flimsy
customer_reviews.text: The installation of this kickstand was much harder than needed. I have a specialized that case with the center hole. The screw that comes with stand uses an abnormally large hex hole and none of my Alan wrenches fit. My bike doesn’t leave much room for me to twist with my fingers so I have to use need nose pliers to tighten the screw. The extension bar is also a bit weak feeling. I have a feeling the stand may break over time especially if you have it extended like I do on my 29er. I would tell others to look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Kidd

customer_reviews.title: You may need to go to the hardware store to install due to screws or tools needed
customer_reviews.text: Received it today and it looks solid and easy to adjust the length. Had to give the Easy to Install rating a 1 since the screws provided aren't long enough for a Jamis Mountain Bike. Need to go to the local hardware store to get one that works. Additionally, the longer of the two screws it comes with is a bolt, so if you don't have a socket wrench set, you cannot tighten it properly. Finally, if the shorter screw does fit no allen key comes with it. So again, if you don't already have one, you are taking a trip to the hardware store.
customer_reviews.author: David Kowalski

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit specialized hybrid 29. Buy all metal.
customer_reviews.text: So plastics and aluminum have entered the world of kickstands. Bought this and had to grind about 1.5" off to fit. Had to grind and extra slot as well. Then went to the local do it best and for $8 there was an all metal perfect kick stand. But I'm stuck with a plastic one at 2x the price that will probably break after a few months or years. Best to measure and buy this item local. Stick with the old style all metal. The ones you see on bikes that were made decades ago.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff proud USA Legal Citizen

customer_reviews.title: good idea - needs more support
customer_reviews.text: I liked the design of this kickstand, especially the flexibility with which its height can be adjusted without any tools. The installation package came with a short Allen screw and a taller hex screw. I needed a longer Allen-head screw for the stand to work. I called and left messages but they were not returned. I even went to the Ace store to purchase the screw ( as I had said, I really liked the kickstand), but they could not find a similar fit, leaving me no choice but to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kei

customer_reviews.title: Works great, but you'll need the perfect allen wrench
customer_reviews.text: Took about 5 minutes to install it to my Diamondback Edgewood 28". Used the short bolt, did not need the plate or long hex bolt. The included lock washer keeps it firmly in place. The length adjustment is quick and easy. IMPORTANT: Proper installation would have been about impossible if I hadn't had the perfect allen wrench: 8mm (5/16"), approximately 1 1/2" x 5". The allen needs to be LOOSE, not part of a multi-tool, or you'll probably never get it in there. My socket-set allen would not fit in there either. Unless you have a comprehensive collection of shop tools, be prepared to have to go buy or borrow the right allen wrench.
customer_reviews.author: AVTech

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt stay locked with the type of bracket it comes with.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good if it stayed screwed in one place without shifting. I love the adjustability for different size wheel it has but it seems like no matter how much you tighten the screw its held by it still tends to turn eventually. It should've had some kind of notch or 2 or textured lining that goes against the frame for it to be locked in the same position that you screw it in. Constantly have to tighten the screw that its held to the frame by every time i leave my house. Good simple design, poor execution on connection to the frame.
customer_reviews.author: Steven S.

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional if it holds up
customer_reviews.text: I originally tried a loose "fitting" worried that the kickstand wouldn't align under the frame, but extend outward. But after bolting it down it was a perfect fit for my Fuji road bike. My title was written because the kickstand initiates with a bang so that shock in time might degrade the spring? or something...but that's just me. It's so well designed - just needed a 14mm socket wrench - and the easy way to adjust its length. What a steal!
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Installed on two Co-op DRT 1.1 bikes. Easy install and works perfectly. I love the smart adjustment mechanism. Looks great.
customer_reviews.author: tiff_tiff_tiff

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and excellent adjustment mechanism
customer_reviews.text: I am tired of cutting down kick stands to size, trying to get the length exactly right. This kick stand is a welcome alternative. It installs easily, with just one bolt. The package came with two bolts of different lengths. The bottom of the kickstand has an adjustable, hard plastic sleeve to make it the right length. The only drawback is that there are no instructions with the kick stand, so you may have to do some fiddling to figure it out.
customer_reviews.author: David Mandell

customer_reviews.title: *slaps kickstand* This baby sure can prop up a bicycle
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand came with a washer, two bolts and a metal bracket. My bicycle already has a kickstand plate, so I ended up using the short bolt. I didn’t have a big enough hex key for the bolt but coincidentally I had a 3/8 torx bit that fit. The kickstand is stable even when extended. I’ve had it for about 3 weeks and extended it so that my bicycle stands nearly upright. Even in an extended position it’s stable. And for a possibly useful, possibly useless piece of information, I have 28-inch tires and when the kickstand is up, it has about a 9-inch ground clearance.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - Difficult to Install, but it was the bike's fault & not the kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Installed great on my Specialized hybrid road bike. Frame had a kickstand mount plate already, so I did not have to use the included adapter plate. Adjustable length is a big plus. Kickstand sits closer to the back tire than it needed to (doesn't follow frame as much as I would prefer), but it's far enough that it doesn't cause any trouble. Haven't used for very long, but I have nothing to complain about.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you can tighten it
customer_reviews.text: While the product seemed to be of good quality, i ended up removing it and missed my return window. The problem with it was due to the placement of it. I had to put it on my frame in a place where i could tighten it with my fingers, but that wasn't enough and it got so loose every time i rode my bike, and it would hit my pedal and back wheel, and eventually when i kicked it down, it would just wobble and be more work than it was worth. I think if you could tighten it with tools, it would be a better purchase, but overall i regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Old school attachment, adjustment is easy and works
customer_reviews.text: The clamp on system isn't the best thing for paint, and I suppose one could damage a chainstay. But it works well. I put on padding tape and didn't scar the paint. As for functionality, I haven't had a kick stand for years. I don't know how I survived! My light unloaded bikes are fine without, but my touring bike is so much easier to deal with using a kickstand. I'm very happy with the stand. The bike is pretty stable, about as good as can be expected. And it wasn't too hard to install. Carry a wrench to tighten, though!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Perry

customer_reviews.title: Five star kickstand that’s worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: It may not be easy to install (I had to take it to my bike shop for the service techs to do it, only because I don’t have the proper tools), but once it’s installed, it’s a damn good kickstand that’s worth every dollar. It matches with the color scheme of my bike and it’s sturdy. It’s adjustable as well to all bike sizes. I’m not gonna detract any stars just because I don’t have the proper tools so it’s 5 stars for me.
customer_reviews.author: jcha88

customer_reviews.title: Should do the trick...But just works. May not work for anything over a 26 inch bicycle
customer_reviews.text: Put this on an E-Bike, a prodeco tech 500 stride . Its 26 inch wheels and 2.10 tires. With kickstand at full length, it just was long enough. Little bit of lean, just what I wanted. Not exactly a heavy duty kickstand, more made for lighter bicycle. Didn't care for the original fork type kickstand, cause front wheel would lift off ground and wheel tilt in bad. Prefer a side kickstand. I plan to be easy on it. See how it holds up.
customer_reviews.author: Clifford D. Main

customer_reviews.title: Needs 1/2 inch longer bolt, but great adjustable kickstand!
customer_reviews.text: solid kickstand. I've bought 2 of them. It comes with 2 bolts, but the longer one still wasn't long enough for my bikes. I happened to have one, but I had to but a 59 cent bolt from Ace Hardware to put the second one on. We have Giant mountain bikes with 27.5" wheels (a Large and a Medium). The bolt would probably be fine for most department store bikes but our frames are thicker. Love the adjustment. Super easy to adjust. No tools needed to adjust, just one hand and about 3 or 4 seconds!
customer_reviews.author: BradAndEdie

customer_reviews.title: Solid Product
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my son's bike. Needed a side rail mounted kickstand, as a center frame mounted one would interfere with brake and gear cables. This one worked like a champ. Very solid construction. Springs snap into position easily and smoothly. It was easy to mount, but appears to be very durable. While still relatively new, I have no reason to believe that the product won't last for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Frank Natale

customer_reviews.title: Quite Possibly One of My Favorite Things I've Purchased at Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This kick stand should come standard feature with every bike. If you've put up with your ride falling over, looking unstable, or just plain being wonky, this will solve your problem. Installed in less than 10 minutes (taking off the old one and screwing in the new one is the bulk of the time). Honestly, it's a dream. I replaced one bike with this - then shortly bought 2 more to replace them all. You won't regret this purchase. $10 and pure joy never having to worry about your bike falling over again.
customer_reviews.author: Levelbest

customer_reviews.title: Kickstand works with Trek Dual Sport Bikes!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my 2013 Trek Dual Sport (DS 8.6). Supposedly you can't have a standard kickstand on a Trek Dual Sport because there isn't enough space and clearance in the kickstand mounting location. After years of not having a kickstand on my Trek, I bit the bullet and purchased this adjustable kickstand. This kickstand fits perfectly in the mounting location on my Trek. It does not come in contact with any moving parts, cables, chains, or pedals. The adjustable height on the kickstand is a plus as well. You can raise and lower its height as you choose. It is nice to finally be able to keep my bike standing upright and not having to lay it down.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Genius!  Great design, fantastic product!
customer_reviews.text: Installed on a 2014/2015 Giant Liv women's hybrid bike. This installs like any other standard kickstand, but the ability to adjust its length is genius. Although the sliding part is plastic, it seems strong and is of course lighter weight. The upper part of the stand is metal. The locking mechanism for the adjustable/sliding part works well and seems solid. I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: M. Nomine

customer_reviews.title: Better than any other.
customer_reviews.text: Trec mountain bike never had kickstand, Bolted this on and it has proven to be a superior stand than any I have ever had before. Love the adjustable length feature, very solid and positive action. really holds the bike up and not one of those stands that precariously perches the bike up where a slight breeze will tip it over. EZ install and ez length adjust. VERY STABLE and POSITIVE ACTION. Ride On!
customer_reviews.author: Groovy

customer_reviews.title: Make sure you have an H8 hex bit
customer_reviews.text: Before buying this I figured I have enough tools to handle this extremely easy install or if I didn't, I could brute force it with my tools. Nope. The short bolt is rounded on the outside with a recessed hex, h8, on the inside. The positioning of the plate on my Specialized Crosstrail makes it impossible to position any makeshift solution to apply torque. Had to find out the hard way I needed an H8 hex bit to install. After its on, it's fine as can be but that install...
customer_reviews.author: Bill Huynh

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality; Could be improved
customer_reviews.text: The stand is great build quality, very easy to adjust stand height, and easy to install for this type of kickstand. I wish the plate that holds the bike is slightly longer with layer of plastic that protects the paint on the bike frame
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: 3/8 X 2 1/2 Hex Bolt
customer_reviews.text: That's the size of bolt you'll need for a mountain bike. Get a matching hex nut. While you're waiting for this kickstand to come in the mail, go ahead and get this at your local hardware store. You'll also need grease if you don't have any laying around... Thank me later :) Just for reference, I have a Diamondback Line 27.5. Yes, this kickstand is well worth the few extra dollars you'll spend. Very tough, and well made.
customer_reviews.author: RL

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my 4" tire e-bike.
customer_reviews.text: My fat tire e-bike kickstand was busted so I found this BV kickstand to be a perfect fit. I used the longer supplied bolt and after threading it in tightly I had plenty of threads left to lock everything down using a stop nut. I did have to force the nut down the last couple of turns since the beveled spring housing interfered slightly, but it didn't cause any damage.
customer_reviews.author: chris

customer_reviews.title: I recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: Frustration became statisfaction once I went to my bike. This product came with no directions. The directions are below its Amazon description but are not clear to a person unfamiliar with bike repair and/or this product. Once you look at directions and compare your bike and then place the bracket in the assumed location, the installation becomes obvious.You then tighten bolt, adjust kickstand to pereferred length and its a done deal. Bike has its proper lean and I dont have to lean it against walls or flip it upside down to rest on handlbars and seat.I recommend this product, I havent rode because of temps yet, but it clears pedal.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny Jay

customer_reviews.title: Dumb bolt design
customer_reviews.text: I really don’t know why they made such a massive bolt that requires a very large hex/allen wrench. They give you two different bolts, one with a hex head that could easily use a ratchet to tighten and then the other is this ridiculously massive hex key size that isn’t in any standard drill bit sets. Just make one head, the bolt with a hex head and that’s it. A 30 second job turned into 30 minutes of total frustration. Stupid.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M.

customer_reviews.title: Fits on GT Agressor Pro
customer_reviews.text: Fits on GT Agressor Pro with cable wire n all. Took off rear wheel and tightened it down quite a bit cause top piece doesnt perfectly fit into the little square, but doesnt budge now when deploying/retracting. Works great.
customer_reviews.author: Marv Elous

customer_reviews.title: Nope, not on my touring bicycle!
customer_reviews.text: Really wishing I had read more in to this. Figured, how could I go wrong with an Amazon Choice product? Threw this thing straight in the trash. The mounting clamp is a barbaric metal-on-metal clamp that you wrench down with a large bolt. Not only did the clamp not fit, but if you care about your bicycle- if it's anything other than a Walmart bike- you will not install this kickstand. It will chew the hell out of your bike causing it to rust and wear prematurely, possibly do great damage to the frame in a wreck.
customer_reviews.author: TRohr

customer_reviews.title: Very stable and easy to install
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install. Easily attached to the frame of the mountain bike, which never had a kickstand previously. Easy to adjust the height with a simple tool free adjustment. Very stable when adjusted to the proper height. You will only need a #8 Allen wrench to install. The kickstand does not interfere with the pedals. Easily stows out of the way.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: The plastic part is very strong.
customer_reviews.text: A few years ago I won a nice Marin bike but it didn't have a kick stand. I finally decided I needed one and ordered this one after looking at several. Not disappointed. It looks like it belongs on the bike and works very well. I read some complaints about the plastic end on it but it is very solid and I don't see that as problem. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Was easy to add to my sons bike. The kickstand is adjustable but it’s made for a bigger bike. We used this on my 5yr olds bike and it BARELY works. The bike sits perfectly vertical with this making it unstable (falling the opposite direction) because of how long the kickstand is. This is no fault of the kickstand or manufacturing just something to consider when ordering- measure the size you need for your child’s bike. Otherwise everything about this was easy to use and seems like it will hold up well.
customer_reviews.author: RetailTherapy

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic kickstand!
customer_reviews.text: No complaints here. Yes, a tad hard to assemble because there is a learning curve depending on your bike, but now that it's on it works fantastic. I wasn't sure I needed a kickstand for my mountain bike, but now that I have it I'm totally satisfied. It totally saves damage from skidding the peddles or the handlebar grips on the hard ground, and when I stop off to take a break it's just awesome.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Mc Kee

customer_reviews.title: Salsa Dos Niner Bicycle Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand fits as if it were made for my bike. One bolt is all it took and an andjustment for lenght. When it is all said and done, this $10.00 stand supports my $3000.00 bike. I spent a lot of time seaching for the perfect stand and this one is it. There is no interference with any of the controls and the internal spring makes it a perfect fit.
customer_reviews.author: gabriel murphy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Know the size.
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent stand. Very lightweight, but extremely sturdy. Easy to install, and adjustable. It is a tad too big for my son's 24" bike. It's adjustable but it's already on the shortest setting.. It stands too upright so that it's tippy, so we have to be careful. It would be fine on any adult bike (I should nick it for my bike.)
customer_reviews.author: Janna

customer_reviews.title: A little bulky
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a road bike but there was not enough clearance to install it It’s very beefy- so I assume it will hold up wel. I put it on a mountain bike that I have that has no kickstand - it was probably too large for the road bike anyway. The biggest downside is it does not stop tightly against the frame so I’m afraid it will get caught on things on the mountain Bike. I think for a casual bike, the city cruiser, beach cruiser, etc this would be a great kickstand
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality, tough install
customer_reviews.text: So every bike is different, but installing this on my wife's hybrid Trek was tough. There's no easy way to get a grip on the bolt and nut with the bike's design. Took some pliers and at least 30 minutes of slow spinning to get this on. I have tons of tools, but the bolt doesn't have a bit, it's just a nut and good luck getting in there on some bikes.
customer_reviews.author: B-lo

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charmed kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Kickstand was super easy to install and the simple latch adjustment at the end is super easy to use even if seldom changed. The only advice I would give is to make sure you really really tighten the screw. The first few days, the kickstand would keep shift out due to the weight of the bike while resting. Since tightening, the stand has remained in position.
customer_reviews.author: wxydesign

customer_reviews.title: Burley
customer_reviews.text: So having a kickstand is just great, however having a kickstand on a mountain bike is problematic, as you'll likely beat it up on rocks and what not. This one has been just great. We put it on my son's hard tail and it's been wonderful. No problems with durability. Even after some nasty falls, it's been fine. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Adjustable
customer_reviews.text: It's adjustable to increments where your bike won't lean too much or look imbalanced. It bolts on properly to my trek, though I really couldn't get a lock. It holds on enough that it won't move at all when you're in riding motion. When parking, it won't leave your bike falling, but when parking à long time, it might move a little that you have to push it inwards a bit after unparking. I no longer use it to kinda make my bike look free-er and save I tiny bit of weight.
customer_reviews.author: Aldee

customer_reviews.title: Good adjustable kickstand
customer_reviews.text: Stand came with 2 screws, a long hex head bolt to use if the frame has no welded plate, and a shorter button head that is supposed to work on frames with a mounting plate. The problem is the large hex key needed to fit the short screw. I used the hex bolt, and my socket set, and have excess threads sticking out. Hey, it works.
customer_reviews.author: DickW

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit for both our bikes!
customer_reviews.text: Kickstand works great. We’ve replaced two of our kickstands. One on an Electra Townie and the other on a smaller no-name beach cruiser. The adjustable kickstand was a perfect fit for both bikes. And I love the fact I can adjust it a click or two taller for added stability when my daughters put the loaded baskets in their bikes.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my wife's after a fit of rage and I threw her bike and the kickstand snapped in half...I actually like this better than any other kickstand I have had my entire life. The wide foot, keeps it planted better on hot asphalt. Plus the easy adjustment on it, can be quickly adjusted with a simple action. Love it. Will buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Neusiis

customer_reviews.title: Solid stand for 27.5 MTB
customer_reviews.text: Got this stand for my son's 27.5 MTB. I like that this stand is adjustable, making it very easy to fit. This stand looks very rigid and durable. Although, the adjustable part is made of plastic, it looks and feels really tough. You can tell by flicking the stand open - it gives a really solid snap. Installation is quick and easy. The front derailleur was a bit low and with the low profile attachment of this stand, it fits perfectly. Overall, this product is great. I just hope it lasts long but I know it depends on the use (or abuse).
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Spring action is strong and a much better kickstand than original issue.
customer_reviews.text: The kickstand works perfectly for my Electra Townie 7. No problems with installation using the shorter bolt and lock washer with MM allen wrench. Even had to pull it out a couple clicks to make it work like a champion. Seems well-made and sturdy enough. Spring action is strong and a much better kickstand than original issue.
customer_reviews.author: Rogue Literary Society

customer_reviews.title: It will work for now
customer_reviews.text: It will work. I dont like the bottom part is plastic but it seems to work. I like that it can be adjusted on the fly. I tried to put on an old Trek and it moves around alot, not the fault of the kickstand, they will all do this like this. I put on my sons bike that had a slightly short kick stand and its working pretty good. Hopefully it will last a few years.
customer_reviews.author: DJK

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, tricky install without a plate
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat it for the price, and the quality is superb - sturdy, adjustable, and looks like it will last. However, if you don't already have a kickstand plate on your frame, the install is a bit tricky. I needed some muscle to get the job done. It worked! But I wish I had a kickstand plate because installing it directly to the frame seems OK, but not optimal.
customer_reviews.author: J. Elker

customer_reviews.title: I never thought I would care about a kickstand, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is such a good kickstand. Its light, its sturdy, its adjustable. So it fits my bike perfectly. I really never thought that a simple item like a kickstand, which is something many riders take off, would be something I am impressed with. But I really am. If you are looking for a kickstand, consider this one.
customer_reviews.author: Billy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect replacement for my sons Schwinn mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn kick stand broke after about 2 weeks and grabbed one of these for a replacement. Bolted right on in the same position and works perfectly. This is on a 26 inch and there is plenty of adjustment for larger bikes as well. This one bolted to the bottom of the frame in the middle of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: flyin-lowe

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stay put
customer_reviews.text: This seemed like a good kickstand and the stand itself is nice, but it does not stay put. Even while tight, the kickstand keeps moving out somehow and interfering with the pedal. Then, the bolt keeps loosening over time and has to constantly be re-tightened. I'll add some lock-tite and see if it helps, but for such as simple thing, it really shouldn't be necessary.
customer_reviews.author: AW

customer_reviews.title: Strong and Simple
customer_reviews.text: Just received this today. I installed it in about 30 seconds, on a 29" Diamondback mountain bike. It works perfectly! The adjustment for different size bikes is very easy to use, and is done in about 1 second. I'm just glad I bought this, and would buy it again. As I said, I just received it today, so durability is something I can't comment on, but it seems very sturdy and should last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If It Fits Your Bike This is the Kickstand to Get
customer_reviews.text: I got two of these, one for each of my Diamondback bicycles. It fit perfectly on my wife's Haanjo Metro but on my regular Haanjo there is a cable on the back of the frame and insufficient room between the tire and the cable to install the stand. Sad, because these stands seem very well made, and the one on my wife's Haanjo Metro was super easy to adjust, and it operates very crisply.
customer_reviews.author: KeithK906

customer_reviews.title: Quick install: Trek Marlin 4 and Trek 3500
customer_reviews.text: The bike store told me "real bikes don't have kickstands"... but after my kiddos bumped our mountain bikes over a few times I decided I couldn't accept that answer. Installed in under 10 minutes each, quickly adjusted height and moved on with life. Wish I'd done it before my poor bike fell over all those times.
customer_reviews.author: Matt H.

customer_reviews.title: Better than original, won't scuff floor
customer_reviews.text: Bought this because the one that came with the bike was pointy metal, and we occasionally have to store the bikes inside on wood flooring. This stand looks better than the original, has easily adjustable length, and has a rubber foot that won't damage the floor. Installed on an adult beach cruiser bike.
customer_reviews.author: R. Fink

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and durable
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty heavy mountain bike converted into a daily commuter with lots of added weight. I wasn’t sure this stand would hold up but it’s been great! Easy to install and adjust the height based on your bike and the preferred angle of the bike when the stand is down. I am ordering another one now for my wife’s bike
customer_reviews.author: Uri Shinsky

customer_reviews.title: A quality bike needs a quality kick stand
customer_reviews.text: For whatever reason, makers of quality bicycles don't equip or even offer kickstands. WTFKW? The bike store where I purchased my Trek sold me a a cheap scagly universal kickstand for $15. It worked but not all that great and was just sub par. I found this one which coordinates perfectly with my bike, it is more stable and it cost less. As to installation, it comes down to the configuration of your bike, I suppose the long bolt would work better were it a quarter of an inch longer but no biggie. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: R. K. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be doctored but over all not bad
customer_reviews.text: I bought for a 29.6 inch bike. Its still not long enough and the bolt loosen up and had made me fall while riding. Feel like it need better locking nut and a better bracket. Its made well and swings easy the kickstabd part so no complaints at all there. Very light to. With quick hardware store trip it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Horrible !!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I liked that you can adjust for different bike sizes, wish it could have lasted longer than 3 months, SKIP THIS PRODUCT !!!
customer_reviews.author: vindog57

customer_reviews.title: No installation instructions or tools included
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand comes with the largest hex bolt I’ve ever seen and no Allen wrench to install it with. I have to go to the hardware store to see if they even stock an Allen wrench in that size.
customer_reviews.author: WindWitch

customer_reviews.title: Did the job well, might be a tough fit on some bikes.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Nishiki Colorado 29er bike. It fits (barely), and was a real pain in the hump to get mounted, but once I got the bolt started, I got it on. (Had to use a crescent wrench a little at a time, since there's almost NO room on the Colorado to get in there, and I didn't have a open end wrench in this size.) Mounting hassles aside, it's nice. Super easy to adjust the height, looks good on my bike (which has a flat black finish) and didn't get in the way of my pedal/crank. Strong spring keeps it tucked up tightly.
customer_reviews.author: MonkeyBunker

customer_reviews.title: Use W-D 40 on the screw
customer_reviews.text: Almost junked it because it was impossible to hand-tighten the bolt far enough to allow clearance for the hex driver to finish. They powder coated the threads. After we coated the bolt threads and the inside of the mounting hole with W-D 40, we were able to hand tighten 90% and then use the tool to finish.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Bought a new bike and of course it doesn't come with a kick stand so I got this one after reading up on a few. It's great! Fits the bike perfect and comes with different hardware to encompass whatever style your bike is. Very solid feel and the adjustable part is also very solid.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Stalker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent !
customer_reviews.text: Used to replace an OEM one that was worn out on bike. Used on a Electra bike. Was a 5 minute install, matched factory mounting exactly. Like the adjustable height to keep the bike stationary without falling over. Would purchase again if the durability would be sufface.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M

customer_reviews.title: Good Stand
customer_reviews.text: This kickstand gets the job done for my 27.5 inch women's bike. The only downside and I'm hoping this goes away with constant use is that the kickstand is loud. The spring (or whatever mechanism is inside that allows the kickstand to come up and down) makes a loud noise whenever you lower or raise the kickstand. This does not hinder the operation of the kickstand and it doesn't matter too much because you're usually in an outdoor space. Overall, I am pleased with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install once you know where to put on your bike
customer_reviews.text: Installed in on my son’s 24” trek mt200. There’s no instructions with the product, the one in the product description didn’t help. Luckily after viewing some of the postings here I’m able to install it quite easily. I didn’t need to extend the kickstand but I tried it’s very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my Evo Cross
customer_reviews.text: I purchased an e-bike (Evo Cross) last year and absolutely love it. The only negative so far is the kickstand broke at the mount. I contacted the dealer and they would have ordered a new one for me but it would may have involved a longer wait than I desired. Ordered this and it looks as good as stock and does a good job of supporting my 51 lb e-bike. Can't speak for durability but at this price if it lasts a year I'm good.
customer_reviews.author: cmak20

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: Overall a decent product. It gets a little unsteady when you fully extend the length, but most likely you won’t need the full length. The lock washer is junk, particularly since a flat washer isn’t included to keep it from getting mangled as you tighten the bolt.
customer_reviews.author: web 2.0

customer_reviews.title: Better than originals
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting this to be large and clunky, and feared that it might have a fair amount of play in the adjustments place - but it didn't. It's really sturdy and has worked wonderfully so far. It feels nicer than the kickstands that come on most bikes and I didn't even have to adjust it. I would like it to be a bit thinner, but I understand that it wouldn't be adjustable that way. I would even consider this as an upgrade from a bike that already had a kickstand. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Hunter D.

customer_reviews.title: Will not fit Specialized Sirrus Elite
customer_reviews.text: Will not fit my Specialized Sirrus Elite. It simply won't fit in the location for a kickstand. The large tightening plate interferes with the cable running adjacent to the insertion point. Sending it back since I won't be able to install it securely.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Good value, Heavy duty and equal to the middle mount type.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one middle frame mount, and one that mounts on the tire mount frame. They both hang the same 3 inches below the frame. One is not better than the other on a Marlin 5 Trek bike. Pick your flavor and get the same result. Very heavy duty and sturdy with a firm spring-back when retracted. I own two of them and would buy again if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fits well, little complex to install
customer_reviews.text: I got this on time. It took little bit time to install since there was no mention about which tool to use to install. Probably send the right tool along with this or add details about installation tool will be more helpful. Stand fits perfectly to 24” kids bike and working as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Amzon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product but came with no instructions
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product, but it came with no instructions or pictures. Literally just the kickstand in a plastic bag. It was not self-explanatory at all. Fortunately I was already planning on taking my bike into the shop for something else, so I didn't have to figure it out myself. I for sure would not have been able to put it in by myself with no directions.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Solid kickstand so far
customer_reviews.text: Easy install and adjustable design works well for me. As long as you have enough space between the seat tube and back tire, the bolt tightens very well and it's relatively straight forward. Been using it for a few weeks and no sign of budging when I kick it up and down
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Vagabond

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the wife's bike. Installation was very easy and took all of two minutes. The stand retention is strong so I feel confident it won't fall down while riding even on the trails. Easily supports the bike weight, looks good and stays out of the way while in the up position. Only criticism I have is it didn't come with a nut for the bolt. It certainly holds tight without it but I like to over-engineer everything so an easy trip to the hardware store fixed that.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen B.

customer_reviews.title: No Problems and Recommend
customer_reviews.text: We bought this kick stand and was happy how easy it was to install and also how easy to adjust the height of the stand itself so you can adjust height so bike could lean more or less when the stand rod is down. Install only took us 1-2 minutes.
customer_reviews.author: dinosmongoose

customer_reviews.title: Moves around while peddling.
customer_reviews.text: Not at all what I was expecting. Much clunkier and bigger than it needs to be. It still works but gets in the way while peddling often. The quality of the item is okay. Adjusting it for different bike sizes is not easy. Design is nice. I’ll try to locate a different place to installed it. The stand stability is poor. Height adjustment is critical.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. Tracy

customer_reviews.title: Can't be installed without specialty hex wrench if you have a mounting plate
customer_reviews.text: This seems like a perfectly good kickstand. Like other reviewers, I have no way of knowing, because I couldn't install it. If you have a mounting plate on your bike for a kickstand, don't bother. The hex wrench required is far larger than any hex wrench in a standard bike repair tool kit and to top it off, the kickstand receiver threads were painted, making it very difficult to screw in either bolt. Sort of a facepalm dealbreaker for what otherwise seems to be a great kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Best Deal Out There!
customer_reviews.text: This bike kickstand is amazing. It's absolutely perfect for bikes that lack a kickstand. I have a 2008 Novara Safari touring bike that came without a kickstand. After buying a crappy "bar-grip" style kickstand that didn't work, I thought I may just have to deal with not having a kickstand. This product changed all of that! Best deal period.
customer_reviews.author: Drew E.

customer_reviews.title: Mounting hardware included with stand is unusable.
customer_reviews.text: The kick stand itself seems OK, it's the mounting hardware that is awful. It came with two bolts, a too short 7mm allen wrench bolt, and a longer hex head bolt. No nut was included. The longer bolt head is too large to screw down flush to the base plate. The spacer that goes on the other side is too wide to fit between the chain stays on any of the six bikes I have in the garage. I have to wonder how crap like this get's sold.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Kickstand
customer_reviews.text: I’m really pleased with this kickstand. It has a good, snappy motion and the bike has no tendency to fall over. The adjustability is handy, and the latch feels like it will last. The black color is a little more glossy than I had hoped, but that is the only complaint I have.
customer_reviews.author: i_reader

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what we needed! I’d tried another universal kickstand that wasn’t long enough but this one was perfect! Even when you have the kickstand fully extended it’s still strong enough to hold my bike with the attached trailer. Super easy to instal!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kickstand
customer_reviews.text: This went on my wife's mountain bike, which didn't come with a kickstand. We tried a Bell kickstand at first, and it was a piece of junk - it wasn't long enough, it didn't mount quite right, and it wasn't even strong enough to hold it up most of the time. This one is the complete opposite! It's sturdy, mounted perfectly, and adjusts long enough with room to spare. Her bike is a Nishiki Tamarack with 17" frame.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy P

customer_reviews.title: Well designed and constructed.  But may be too intrusive.
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised on my 20 year old Trek, but just barely. The threaded top plate was just barely long enough and the whole assembly just barely clears the rear gearshift cable. Only time will tell if I can put up with it..... Hope the benefits of having a kickstand outweigh the fact that it sticks out a bit and hopefully won't interfere with my left foot.
customer_reviews.author: JLT

customer_reviews.title: Hex and socket head screws are weird...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these kickstands for Trek Verve 3 and FX 3. It's so easy to adjust the height. I like the rubber tip at the end. Sturdy. But if you don't have the proper tools it will be hard to screw the kickstands in place because the rear tire is in the way. I do find it a bit weird the long screw is hex head but the short screw is socket head. If you end up using the short screw you will have to remove the rear tire to mount the kickstand.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Pan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality bike kick stand but leg tension too strong slide around when you use it.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality bike kick stand but scratch up the bottom of my bike due to ridiculous leg spring tension. The leg will slide out a little every time you use it. Eventually, the leg will hit the crank. Rubber pad should solve the issue. I am returning it a different one hopefully with rubber padding or weaker spring tension.
customer_reviews.author: Alz

customer_reviews.title: Perfect kickstand- strong, tunable, elegant, quiet, easy install
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic kickstand- better than in local bike shops. Very strong, highly tunable, and easy to install. Makes a very satisfying click when it locks in place and has just the right amount of tension to ensure no movement while cycling. It’s aesthetically pleasing and the length adjustability is great depending on whether you’re parking on the street or on the side of a hill. Planning to buy this kickstand for all my bikes.
customer_reviews.author: S. Banerjee

customer_reviews.title: Great kickstand!
customer_reviews.text: I liked this kick stand so much for my wife's bike, that I'm ordering one for my mountain bike. It's well made and the length is super easy to adjust. Like other reviewers have stated, the long bolt wasn't long enough, but I ended up using the provided allen bolt instead. I had to go to Ace Hardware to buy a large allen wrench, but thought it was worth it since I'm buying another one of these kickstands for my bike.
customer_reviews.author: John T. Gardner

customer_reviews.title: Awesome kickstand. The adjustment feature is great for kid's bikes
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son's bike to replace a kickstand that wasn't operating smoothly anymore. I am very pleased with this kickstand: it was easy to install, has a very smooth action, just the right curves so that it neither sticks out sideways nor comes close to the wheel in the up position, and the adjustment mechanism made it super easy to adjust to the bike's height (no need to cut to length with a hacksaw). It also has a little "foot" on the end so it doesn't sink in soft ground, e.g. at the park. I will no doubt be moving this kickstand from bike to bike in the years to come.
customer_reviews.author: MNE

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh.......
customer_reviews.text: Very light duty. The mechanism that affixes it to the bike doesn't hold it in place very well and I find I'm having to move it out of the way of the pedals, on both bikes I put them on, every few rides. I don't want to over tighten it and strip out the threads. Whenever this fails I'll look for something different.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Samuel Wagoner

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy stand but not universal, requires cross bar lacking on many bike models
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, good quality item, which doesn’t provide a universal fit. Requires middle bar present on certain models of bikes. Description does not indicate the requirement. Had to order a different model that goes onto the fork holding the real wheel.
customer_reviews.author: Guygo

customer_reviews.title: Too small for 29" Bike!
customer_reviews.text: This is too small for 29" bike. It feels like my bike is standing on an icicle. If you touch it it will fall over (and it will). I don't love this product. It seems well made, but I don't think it was made for 29" bikes...
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Choy

customer_reviews.title: Solid mount, well designed adjustable sleeve, just what I needed for my Breezer Finesse.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Breezer Finesse, and the Nuvo center-mount kickstand that came with it had two problems. First it was about an inch shorter than was ideal to hold up the bike, second when it was up it was so close to the left pedal crank that sometimes the arm would touch until I tapped on it with my heel. This BV kickstand solved both. I adjusted it out about 3 clicks (nice solid sleeve design) and it's just right, and it also has a scalloped shape that keeps it farther from the pedal. Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.author: RS

product_meta.title: BV Adjustable Bicycle Kickstand with Concealed Spring-Loaded Latch, for 24-29 Inch Bike Kickstand
product_meta.description:
The KA76 kickstand is a unique patented design that features a hidden adjustability latch. The spring-loaded latch lifts up, allowing the foot to smoothly glide along the kickstand and lock into place when the latch is closed. A steel hexagonal bolt prevents the foot from sliding off completely and deters vandals. Adjust the kickstand without any tools, anywhere, anytime. 

Made of aluminum alloy, the kickstand is designed to fit most lightweight, midweight and cruiser bicycles 24" to 29" and easily installs with a bottom bracket mount that fits on a bike's chain stay neck. Riders can adjust their bikes to rest at any angle, which is great for balancing bikes in places where the ground is uneven. It is available in ED black or V-Polished silver.

The reinforced plastic foot has a non-slip sole to prevent slipping on wet surfaces and sinking in mud.

Specifications

Material: Aluminum Alloy
Bicycle size: 24"-29"
Dimensions: 14"-16.5" x 0.5"-2" x 1.5"
Weight: 0.56 lbs.
feature_bullets: Tool-less adjustabe length - Spring-loaded latch for adjusting the length of the kickstand
Non-slip sole and wide reinforced plastic foot prevents slipping and sinking in mud
Steel hexagonal bolt prevents the foot from sliding off the kickstand and deters vandals
Any angle stance (great for balancing bikes on uneven ground)

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
